comment.author: 14884347@N00
comment._content: I love those pictures! But the automatic scan process definitively doesn't do them justice... I got no photoshop skills whatsoever, but made a "quick fixed" version of this one anyway. Enjoy! ;)

comment.author: 87667117@N00
comment._content: i agree i learned photoshop using these pictures its a shame that they treated these pictures this way   the auto scan   takes from the black boarder and darkens the picture i cant belive some of the oohs and arrrs comments  people have made  over these slipshod   scans

comment.author: 22187539@N07
comment._content: the clouds in the background are breathtaking. the composition of this is perfect.

comment.author: 73695771@N00
comment._content: I say cut the LOC a break.  They are at least putting them up.  With mass scannings, I do not expect the best.

comment.author: 14884347@N00
comment._content:
Cashaw> I'm not blaming them for anything:
every person having to go through a lot of color negatives scanning knows how time consuming it is, and they have a HUGE lot of negatives.

That's why I took the liberty to try and do better:
I wasn't thinking it could be considered as an attack or whatever...

comment.author: 7860243@N04
comment._content: Buffalo soldiers, however, I can't help thinking the term Negro is a tad racist...aren't they just Americans?

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Good morning, We published a blog post about a gallery created by a Flickr member using this photo. You can see it here - blog.photography.si.edu/2010/02/10/what%e2%80%99s-not-to-... Best, Effie, the Smithsonian

comment.author: 87667117@N00
comment._content: they have been online for years in fact it was one of the first photo archives to go on line  ,  and it not like the people charged with posting them are  doing it for  free , but its a shame to see such slipshod  photos of very historical  times being presented like this
